Lack of motivation: Remote employees may feel disconnected from the company culture and struggle to stay motivated without the support and camaraderie of their colleagues.
Difficulty in managing workload: It can be challenging to monitor and manage the workload of remote employees, as it may be difficult to track their progress and ensure they are meeting deadlines.
Inadequate collaboration: Remote teams may struggle to collaborate effectively, as they may not have the same level of interaction and teamwork as in-person teams.
Cybersecurity risks: Remote employees may be more vulnerable to cybersecurity threats, as they may use personal devices and work in unsecured environments.
Work-life balance: Remote employees may struggle to maintain a healthy work-life balance, as the boundaries between work and personal life may become blurred.
